info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 12 at 7:33PM MST until August 12 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Cochise County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 900 PM MST.
* At 733 PM MST, Areas of blowing and suspended dust were located throughout Cochise County.
HAZARD...Between one and three miles visibility.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Douglas, Bisbee, Benson, Willcox, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Portal, Naco, Bowie, Dragoon, Pearce-Sunsites, Chiricahua National Monument, Bisbee-Douglas Airport, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Fort Huachuca and Parker Canyon Lake.
This includes the following highways... Route 90 between mile markers 290 and 336. Route 80 between mile markers 293 and 415. Route 181 between mile markers 39 and 64. Route 191 between mile markers 1 and 92. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 355. Interstate 10 between mile markers 297 and 391. Route 82 between mile markers 46 and 67. Route 83 between mile markers 3 and 6.
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
